name: Furnace Creek Visitor Center
description: Furnace Creek Visitor Center is the central hub for all things Death Valley. Here you can pay the park entrance fee, speak with a ranger about trip plans or questions, participate in the Junior Ranger program, watch the 20-minute park film, explore museum displays, and browse the park bookstore.

images.title: Furnace Creek Visitor Center Entrance
images.altText: A paved walkway leading to the brick one-story building.
images.caption: Thousands of people visit Furnace Creek to talk to rangers, watch the park film, learn from exhibits, and shop in the bookstore.

images.title: Furnace Creek Visitor Center Desk
images.altText: A ranger and a visitor look at a map displayed on a desk.
images.caption: Rangers are available to answer questions and help you plan your visit.

images.title: Visitor Center Exhibits
images.altText: Statues of two life sized desert bighorn sheep on a rocky cliff with exhibit panels.
images.caption: Statues of life-sized desert bighorn sheep meet visitors at the entrance to the exhibit hall.

images.title: Bookstore sales
images.altText: Shirts, mugs, books, postcards and other items for sale.
images.caption: Death Valley Natural History Association, the park's non-profit partner, offers bookstore, refreshment, and souvenir sales within the visitor center.

operatingHours.description: The Furnace Creek Visitor Center is open every day of the year, including holidays.
operatingHours.name: Furnace Creek Visitor Center

name: Stovepipe Wells Ranger Station
description: Stovepipe Wells Ranger Station offers a location to talk to a ranger and pay the park's entrance fee. Note: This is a contact station, not a full visitor center. The hours listed below can change and are dependent on staffing level. Please call: (760) 786-3200 for today's hours.

images.title: Stovepipe Wells Ranger Station
images.altText: A small building with an awning and concrete walkway. There is a flag in the front and a sign.
images.caption: Stovepipe Wells Ranger Station.
